attack_paths.justification: This attack path exploits the SMB service running on port 445, which is a common target for remote code execution vulnerabilities. The presence of the SMBGhost vulnerability (CVE-2020-0796) with a CVSS score of 10.0 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the Windows Server 2016 host. Given that this service is exposed, it poses a significant risk for exploitation.

mitre_chain.description: The attacker exploits the SMBGhost vulnerability (CVE-2020-0796) to gain initial access to the isolated-host by sending specially crafted packets to the SMB service on port 445.
mitre_chain.defensive_context: To prevent this step, ensure that the latest Microsoft security updates are applied to mitigate the SMBGhost vulnerability.
mitre_chain.detection_ideas: Monitor for unusual SMB traffic patterns or attempts to connect to the SMB service from unauthorized sources.
